title: Calories in an Orange Bell Pepper
meta_description: Discover calories in bell pepper orange, including carbs, fiber, vitamins, full nutrition breakdown per medium pepper, and preparation tweaks.
h1: Calories in an Orange Bell Pepper
assumptions: Medium-sized (119 g), raw, whole with edible skin and flesh; seeds and core removed for consumption.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, ripeness, growing conditions, and preparation; values are approximate. Check produce labels or databases for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One medium orange bell pepper provides about 30 kcal, mainly from carbs with high vitamin C.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts style for easy comparison to packaged foods.

faqs.q: How many calories in one orange bell pepper?
faqs.a: Approximately 30 kcal for a medium raw orange bell pepper.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a bell pepper orange?
faqs.a: About 7.2 g total carbs, including 2.5 g fiber and 5 g sugars per medium pepper.

faqs.q: Is an orange bell pepper low in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, only 0.4 g total fat per medium pepper, with negligible saturated fat.

faqs.q: Calories in bell pepper orange vs. green?
faqs.a: Similar; orange is slightly sweeter with ~30 kcal vs. ~25 kcal for green, both low-calorie.

faqs.q: Does cooking change calories in orange bell pepper?
faqs.a: Minimal change if no oil added; roasting may slightly increase density, but stays around 30 kcal.
